body.name: Silverwing: The Graphic Novel (The Silverwing Trilogy)
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by HPB-Diamond.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Kenneth Oppel is the author of numerous books for young readers. His award-winning Silverwing trilogy has sold over a million copies worldwide and been adapted as an animated TV series and stage play. Airborn won a Michael L. Printz Honor Book Award and the Canadian Governor General’s Literary Award for children’s literature; its sequel, Skybreaker, was a New York Times bestseller and was named Children’s Novel of the Year by the London Times. He is also the author of Half Brother, This Dark Endeavor, Such Wicked Intent, and The Boundless. Born on Canada’s Vancouver Island, he has lived in Nova Scotia and Newfoundland, Canada; in England and Ireland; and now resides in Toronto with his wife and children. Visit him at KennethOppel.ca.Christopher Edwin Steininger is an artist from Saskatchewan, Canada, and has worked in books, video games, and TV and film. You can find more about his work on his website Steininger.art.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 13 hrs 22 mins
body.description: A small bat blown off course makes the perilous journey home with new friends in the adventurous middle grade odyssey from award-winning author Kenneth Oppel—this bestselling story is now available in graphic novel format!Shade the young silverwing bat may be the runt of his colony, but he’s determined to prove himself on the long, dangerous winter migration to Hibernaculum—millions of wingbeats to the south. Too soon, his hopes are dashed when a fierce storm catches Shade in its grasp. Driven far from the others by the unforgiving winds, Shade is left alone. On his journey back to his family, Shade meets other winged loners. Marina is a Brightwing bat with a strange metal band on her leg, Zephyr the mystical albino bat has an unusual gift, and Goth the carnivorous vampire bat is the largest bat Shade has ever seen. Shade will need all the help he can get if he hopes to reunite with his colony, but with a long and perilous flight ahead, how will he know who to trust?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brother loves it
reviews.reviewText: The book is everything he wanted and more. The details are gorgeous and the book is robust

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Xenofiction and bat fans
reviews.reviewText: Words can't describe how much I love this graphic novel and the Silverwing trilogy as a whole, the graphic novel was great with beautiful art that fits the dark vibes and the character designs. I look forward to seeing and reading more!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Silverwing by Kenneth Oppel is a true Classic. I cannot recommend this story enough. The perfect young hero's journey about a little Bat that would end up saving the World. I was beyond thrilled to see this Epic Tale get adapted into a graphic novel. The Art by Christopher Steininger is absolutely beautiful. I couldn't have wished for a better artist to illustrate this world. We need a sequel FAST!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An amazing adaptation of an underrated series!
reviews.reviewText: Though there's a TV series of Silverwing (which sadly ended), it wasn't true to the book, so seeing the book's version come to life with illustrations was a joy. The artwork is fantastic. I hope Sunwing and Firewing get the same love as well!/|'\_<('@,')>_/'|\

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A fantastic adaptation
reviews.reviewText: Truly enjoyed reading this. The stylized backgrounds, vivid use of colors, and art style as a whole really makes the story pop.And I absolutely hope the next books will be adapted into graphic novels too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The Silverwing books were among my absolute favorite as a kid, and so I was excited to see this graphic novel when it came out. It did not disappoint! The artwork is AMAZING! I also really admire that the artist tried to keep the characters looking similar to how they did in the TV show adaptation (which I never watched, but I could see how fans of the show would appreciate the consistency). This is just such a great story, and it's amazing to see it adapted to a graphic novel. It really lends itself well to being made into a visual work of art. You will not regret this purchase! Even if you never read the novels, you don't have to in order to be a fan and appreciate this. The storytelling is great and covers all the main points.
My 8 year old breezed through this book. He loved it.
Read the novel as a kid, had to buy this for the nostalgia. Super cool to reread it with the graphic novel visuals, 10/10, would go back in time to purchase again

You wore these books out as a kid. I still have mine, the spine wrinklier than I am now. The art is beautiful, the story is well adapted, and it got me right back into reading the originals again. I hope there will be more of these!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stunningly beautiful art brings adventure story to life
reviews.reviewText: Okay, full disclosure, I wrote this book, but I'm here to sing the praises of artist Christopher Steininger, without whom this book would quite simply not exist. He was not merely the illustrator but, to use cinema terminology, the storyboard artist, director, cinematographer, production designer and acting coach. So, bravo to Christopher! (And the story's not bad either!)
Took a chance on this and it's a 10/10. Great story with excellent art.
